office: Democratic Member of Congress from North Carolina
key_responsibilities: representing the Member in meetings with constituents and interested parties
requirements: excellent written and verbal communication skills
work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
be a strong team player
at least two years of legislative experience on Capitol Hill

key_responsibilities: assisting the Director with maintaining the Member’s D.C. schedule
efficiently logging and responding to meeting and speaking requests
booking official travel for the Member
requirements: Strong organization and communication skills
able to handle a fast-paced work environment

key_responsibilities: oversee and support the Member’s legislative priorities and all other relevant legislative and policy work
advising the Member on all matters in the issue portfolio which will include Foreign Policy and Health Care
analyzing legislation and drafting vote recommendations and talking points for floor and committee proceedings
staffing the Member in relevant meetings
representing the Member before constituents and stakeholders
requirements: law or advanced degree
significant foreign policy and Jewish Community experience
experience advising a Member of Congress
experience advancing policy proposals
excellent written and verbal communication skills
enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment

key_responsibilities: coordinating some of the District Office’s outreach efforts, especially its Mobile Office Hours program
providing some administrative support to the Congressman’s scheduling operation
requirements: great sense of humor
strong writing skills
the ability to learn quickly
a solid team mentality
valid driver’s license with daily access to a vehicle and good driving record

key_responsibilities: Work on constituent cases, predominantly for veterans
attend events as the Congressman’s representative
monitor and update the Member and District Director on district and local issues
act as liaison with federal, district, and local agencies for the Member and constituents
perform other related duties as assigned
requirements: Strong oral and writing skills
excellent organizational, collaboration and communication skills
strong interpersonal skills
understanding of general military structure
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Congressman’s position on policy issues
ability to multi task and work under pressure to meet deadlines
flexibility with priorities and ever-changing deadlines
detail orientation
ability to meet attendance requirements including a varied and work schedule
ethics in all organizational activities
excel at filming and editing videos
strong writer
experience with graphic design
social media and basic HTML

key_responsibilities: developing and managing the Member’s daily schedule and travel arrangements
organizing the Member’s daily briefing materials
occasionally driving the Member to events
evaluating all incoming invitations and meeting requests
communicating with constituents by phone and email quickly to address requests, concerns, and questions
maintaining office records and office supplies
serving as the emergency office coordinator
requirements: superior organizational skills
strong written and communication skills
poise and ability to thrive in a fast paced environment

key_responsibilities: assisting with the tracking and processing of committee correspondence
providing administrative support in setting up committee meetings
entering data and navigating databases with accuracy
requirements: excellent organizational skills and a professional telephone manner
good computer skills
proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
ability to use good judgment in responding to inquiries and requests
flexibility in assisting with daily tasks and projects

key_responsibilities: assisting the legislative director with drafting legislation
meeting with constituents and interested individuals/organizations
assisting the communications director with updating the website and Facebook and Twitter pages
requirements: highly energetic, motivated and organized
strong writing and interpersonal skills
manage multiple tasks and work well under pressure
bachelor's degree
excellent writing and communication skills
resident of, or be willing to become, a resident of the District of Columbia

key_responsibilities: responding to constituent requests for general information and other inquiries
requirements: maintain a good relationship with the Member, staff, and constituents
willing to accept performance based criticism and direction while working well under pressure
open to having a flexible schedule

key_responsibilities: maintaining accurate lists of annual meetings and long-term planning
management of the intern program and junior staff
management of office equipment and purchasing
requirements: None

key_responsibilities: meet with constituents concerning policy matters
requirements: libertarian or classical liberal in the tradition of F.A. Hayek, Henry Hazlitt, and Frederic Bastiat
strong commitment to individual liberty, economic freedom, the Rule of Law, and the Constitution
excellent writer and clear thinker
BA or equivalent
degree in economics or at least two years of relevant policy experience
